      • executeStatementReturnsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> executeStatementReturnsMap(java.lang.String sql,
                                                                           java.lang.String key,
                                                                           java.lang.String value)
        This method makes a sql Query and returns the keys and values in a Map. We assume that every key is an integer.
        Parameters:
        sql - The query string to be executed
        key - The column name which will be key of the map
        value - The column name which will be the value of the map
        Returns:
        A Map from the key Column to the Value Column

      • executeStatementReturnsMapWithMapWithKeys

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> executeStatementReturnsMapWithMapWithKeys(java.lang.String sql,
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String... keys)

      • executeStatementReturnsMapWithKeys

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> executeStatementReturnsMapWithKeys(java.lang.String sql,
                                                                                  java.lang.String... keys)
        Creates a Map for the SQL-Result. Each Column will be added as a key and the first result as the result.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQl query to be executed.
        keys - The column names.
        Returns:
        A Map of the results.
